gcci.text: While H100 spot prices averaging $3.13/hr reflect constrained supply and long lead times, increased allocations and a gradual shift to newer GPUs should ease allocation risk and improve hyperscaler capex efficiency over the next two quarters.

gtpi.text: At an average input price of $1.25 per million tokens, the ongoing API price war is accelerating commoditization, pushing providers toward efficiency gains through distillation and caching while model competition compresses margins.

gagl.text: AI-driven demand has lifted annual grid load to 120 TWh, intensifying regional grid strain and underscoring the need for demand‑response and storage while accelerating nuclear adoption to stabilize carbon intensity.

aipi.text: Industry sentiment remains buoyant as falling hardware and token prices sustain growth, but aggressive pricing and capacity expansions raise bubble risks that hinge on converting cost declines into durable productivity gains.
